DOC.brief_summary: The aim study assess efficacy feasibility new less invasive surfactant administration ( LISA ) technique specific design cannula surfactant administration use Beractant replacement preterm infant < 32 week gestation compare short long term outcome intubation , administration surfactant extubation method ( INSURE ) . This single-center , prospective , open-label , non-randomized , control study experimental cohort 30 patient treat LISA retrospective control group comprise 30 recently treat patient INSURE . Beractant ( 4 ml/Kg ) administer exogenous surfactant group patient nasal continuous positive airway pressure ( nCPAP ) first three day life need 30 % fraction inspire oxygen inspire oxygen fraction ( FiO2 ) .
